text:
Hector Bellerin denies meeting Barcelona chief as La Liga giants ramp up pursuit of Arsenal ace 
Gunner star's representatives dismiss claims he met Robert Fernandez in London, according to reports By Gary Stonehouse Comments ARSENAL’s Hector Bellerin has denied meeting with Barcelona chief Robert Fernandez in London this week. 
A report in a Spanish publication claimed that the La Liga side’s sporting director had flown to England to speak with the defender. Rex Features 4 Hector Bellerin’s representatives have denied that he met a Barcelona official in London 
However, the Spaniard’s representatives have denied the claims in Cadena that the Gunners star had a face-to-face meeting with Fernandez over a potential return to the Nou Camp. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Barcelona are determined to bring in a right-back this summer and have identified the 22-year-old international as the man they want. 
Bellerin left the giants back in 2011 after spending nearly a decade in their youth academy. 
Since then, he has gone on to become one of Arsenal ’s key men and is one of the first names on Arsene Wenger’s team-sheet. The Gunners managed to tie Bellerin down to a new long-term deal in October, which will have increased the player’s value. 
But that has not deterred Barca’s ambitions to get their man. And Wenger’s future, which remains in doubt, could also come into play when Bellerin determines the next step in his career.
